question: How often do you inspect private fire hydrants?
answer: Annually and after each operation (NFPA 25 2014 Edition, Table 7.1.1.2)

question: What is NFPA 13R used for?
answer: Residential occupancies up to and including four stories in height (NFPA 13R 2016 Edition, Section 1.1)

question: What is the coverage area for Ordinary Hazard heads (Standard Spray)?
What is the coverage area for Light Hazard heads (Standard Spray)?
What is the coverage area for Extra Hazard heads (Standard Spray)?
answer: 100 square feet (Up to 130 sq ft if density ≥ 0.25) (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 8.6.2.2.1(c))

question: What is the coverage area for ESFR heads?
What is the coverage area for Storage heads (CMDA)?
Minimum air pressure for a pressure tank?
answer: 75 psi (General Industry Standard / NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 11.2.3.2.3)

question: What pipe sizes can feed 1½" hose lines and for what length?
answer: 1" for horizontal runs up to 20'; 1¼" for 20' to 80'; 1½" for runs over 80' (NFPA 14 2016 Edition, Table 7.3.1.1)

question: What are the GLASS BULB colors for each temperature rating?
answer: Ordinary: Orange/Red; Intermediate: Yellow/Green; High: Blue; Extra High: Purple; Ultra High: Black (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 6.2.5.1)

question: True or False. Control valves that are controlling a fire sprinkler system in an area accessible to the public, and has 20 or less sprinklers on it does not have to be monitored or locked.
answer: False (Minnesota State Fire Code 2020, Section 903.4 - MN deletes the exception for small systems)

question: How often is the interior of a pressure tank inspected?
answer: Every 5 years; every 3 years without corrosion protection (NFPA 25 2014 Edition, Section 9.2.6)

question: How often do you flow standpipes?
How many heads can be taken off a cold weather valve?
Maximum unsupported length of pipe from end of pipe to last hanger?
Duration of water supply for NFPA 13D systems
answer: 10 minutes (NFPA 13D 2016 Edition, Section 6.1.2 - Note: 7 mins is for 13R in some cases, but 13D specifies 10)

question: Why must a check valve with a 3/32" hole in the Clapper be installed in the system riser below the test valve in freezer spaces?
answer: To prevent evaporation of priming water into system (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.16.4.1.4.4)

question: Maximum time allowed for water flow alarms to sound (Mechanical)?
What pressure and flow are 1½" hose stations designed for (NFPA 13 Allowance)?
answer: 50 gpm (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 11.2.3.1.2 - Inside Hose allowance)

question: Class I and Class III standpipe systems are designed for what pressures and flows?
answer: Most remote standpipe: 500 gpm; Additional standpipes: 250 gpm; Min Pressure: 100 psi (NFPA 14 2016 Edition, Section 7.10.1.1.5)

question: Class II standpipe systems are designed for what pressures and flows?
Acceptance tests required for dry pipe systems
answer: Hydro test, air test (40 psi/24hr), alarm test, trip test (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Chapter 25)

question: Flow of a master stream is?
Bypass around check valve on tank shall be required to fill the tank in how many hours? What is the minimum size of this bypass?
Minimum amount of time to close a control valve?
Why is the eccentric reducer on the suction side of the pump?
answer: To prevent air pockets (NFPA 20 2016 Edition, Section 4.15.6.3)

question: What color FRAME ARMS are on extra high temp sprinkler heads?
answer: Red (Note: Glass Bulbs are Purple) (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 6.2.5.1)

question: What percent of portable fire extinguishers can be removed if 1½" hose lines are capable of reaching all parts of the building?
answer: Up to 50% (Minnesota State Fire Code 2020, Section 906.1)

question: What did NFPA 231C govern?
What type of pipe is not allowed for use in NFPA 13D?
answer: Aluminum or other pipe not listed (NFPA 13D 2016 Edition, Section 5.2)

question: Extra heavy pattern fittings shall be used when?
answer: When pressures exceed 175 psi (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 6.4.3)

question: What is the contractor's certificate used for?
answer: System acceptance / Material and Test Certificate (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 25.1)

question: When are return bends used?
answer: Pendant sprinklers on dry systems (or non-potable water) to prevent sediment accumulation (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.15.18.2)

question: Powder driven studs must have what attached to them?
What size head orifice must be used when installing sprinklers in a kitchen hood and a vent duct?
What temperature heads should be used for light, ordinary, and extra hazard?
Sidewall sprinklers shall not be used under what type of ceiling?
answer: Sloped ceilings or ceilings that aren't flat (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.7.2.3)

question: Are FDCs required for NFPA 13R systems?
answer: Yes, unless single-story building less than 2000 sq ft (NFPA 13R 2016 Edition, Section 6.6.4)

question: Pump rooms shall be lighted and heated?
In scheduled systems, what are the maximum numbers of sprinkler heads that can be taken off sizes 1" through 3"?
Maximum time allowed for water to reach inspectors test on dry pipe system?
Hanger spacing for steel pipe (Schedule 40)
Hanger spacing for threadable lightwall steel pipe 1" to 3"
Hanger spacing for copper tube pipe
Hanger spacing for CPVC pipe
Distance between support of risers shall not exceed?
Hanger required within what distance on horizontal main after riser?
Where does the FDC go on a single zone dry system?
answer: Between dry pipe valve and control valve (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.17.2.4.2)

question: What temperature sprinkler head if above a heat duct?
answer: Intermediate if within 2'6"; High if within 1' (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 8.3.2.5(c) - check specific distance in exam)

question: Seismic bracing and pipe hangers inspected from floor level how often?
Maximum distance between 1½" hose stations?
What is the Minnesota state fire protection code?
What is the fine for working in Minnesota without a Minnesota journeyman's license?
answer: Misdemeanor, up to $1,000/90 days (MN Statutes 609.02 Subd. 3; 299M)

question: What is the maximum square footage of a light hazard zone?
What is the maximum square footage of an ordinary hazard zone?
What is the maximum square footage of an extra hazard zone?
What is the maximum square footage of storage zones?
What is mandatory on the suction side of the pump before the eccentric reducer?
What is mandatory on the discharge side of the fire pump?
answer: Listed check or backflow then an indicating valve (NFPA 20 2016 Edition, Section 4.14.4)

question: When using a cement solvent as a bonding agent you must or must not put a sprinkler head in the fitting before you screw it onto the pipe?
When installing pipe on a dry system inside a refrigerated space, what pitch is required for the mains?
answer: ½" per 10 feet for mains and lines (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.16.2.3.2)

question: Air supply entering the freezer area shall be equipped with two supply lines at least 6 feet long and of what diameter pipe?
What is NFPA 13D used for?
answer: Single and two-family dwellings (NFPA 13D 2016 Edition, Section 1.1)

question: Is an FDC required for an NFPA 13D type system?
There is a new suspended ceiling installed under an existing system, what is the maximum length of the nipple rising out of the tee to supply pendant heads below?
answer: Up to 24" in some cases, but typically <4" for dry. (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.15.19)

question: An area of low temperature and low combustibility is considered what type of hazard?
What is the maximum distance between hangers on 1" schedule 40 pipe?
Minimum clearance between storage and deflector of large drop sprinkler heads?
What type of system works with or without air pressure?
Besides the heads going off on a preaction system, what must happen before water enters the system?
answer: Detection system must be activated (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 7.3.2)

question: A pump room and valve enclosure must maintain a temperature of what to keep from freezing.
True or False. Powder driven studs or welded studs must have a coupling to attach to the rods.
How long should the water supply be capable of supplying all exposure sprinklers during a fire?
A relief valve shall be set to relieve pressure at what psi?
answer: 175 psi or 10 psi over maximum system pressure (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 7.1.2)

question: When does the license for a journeyman expire each year?
When installing an antifreeze system, the solutions shall conform to who?
Minimum operating pressure for a sprinkler head?
What type of pipe is not acceptable for a standpipe?
answer: Pipe not listed for fire protection (NFPA 14 2016 Edition, Section 4.2)

question: When are local waterflow alarms needed?
answer: When there is more than 20 heads (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.17.1)

question: What is the smallest orifice size for a head in a rack storage system?
Minimum clearance between deflector and storage of standard sprinkler head?
Minimum height above grade for a fire hydrant?
Minimum and maximum height above grade an FDC shall be placed?
How often do you check air and water levels on a pressure tank?
How often do you check standpipe components?
How often do you check standpipe valves?
How often do you inspect FDCs?
How often do you inspect kitchen hoods?
How often shall the fire pumps below be run? Diesel vs Electric
answer: Diesel = Weekly (30 min); Electric = Weekly (10 min) (NFPA 25 2014 Edition, Section 8.3.3 - Note: MN often amends to allow Monthly for electric if redundant)

question: Main drain size for risers?
answer: Up to 2": ¾"; 2½" to 3½": 1¼"; 4" and larger: 2" (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 16.10.4.2 - formerly 8.16)

question: Amount of time for a compressor to fill a dry system?
When calculating a sprinkler system, which part is most remote?
answer: Hydraulically Most Remote Area (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 23.4.4)

question: Where do calculations start on a sprinkler system?
How many residential heads do you calculate on an NFPA 13 type calculation?
Distances of a hose valve location above the floor?
When can sprinklers have a closed valve?
answer: When they are constantly attended (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.16.1.1)

question: What type of sprinkler heads do you use when temperatures exceed 100°F?
answer: Intermediate or high temperature (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 8.3.2.5(c))

question: Temperature range for intermediate heads (Glass Bulb)?
A pressure tank shall be at least how full?
answer: At least ⅔ full (NFPA 25 2014 Edition, Section 9.2.3)

question: When the system pressure exceeds 100 psi, the unsupported distance between the end sprinkler in the pendant position or drop nipple and the closest hanger shall not exceed what?
answer: Steel - 1 foot; Copper - 6"; CPVC - 6" (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 9.2.3.4.4)

question: Horizontal piping from the standpipe to the hose connection more than 18" long shall be provided with hangers?
What pitch is required for dry systems?
answer: ½" per 10 feet for mains; ¼" per 10 feet for branch lines (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.16.2.3)

question: Minimum discharge of a residential sprinkler head?
answer: Single head design = 18 gpm; Two head design = 13 gpm (NFPA 13D 2016 Edition, Section 8.1)

question: Maximum spacing between residential sprinkler heads?
answer: 12 feet or 144 sq ft (NFPA 13D 2016 Edition, Section 8.1)

question: Maximum size pipe a lag screw rod can support?
What color bulb is required for a head in a heater zone within a 7 ft circle?
Minimum distance between heads for residential type?
What areas do not need sprinklers in NFPA 13R?
answer: A. Bathrooms < 55 sq ft B. Closets < 24 sq ft C. Porches/balconies D. Attics/concealed spaces (NFPA 13R 2016 Edition, Section 6.6)

question: Lag screw size for 6" pipe?
Length of hose in hose stations?
Sprinklers under skylights shall have what temperature rating?
In attics, what is the maximum distance the heads can be out of center and what is the maximum distance vertically from the peak the heads can be?
answer: Up to 3 ft off center (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.6.4.1.4)

question: In hotels and motels, NFPA 13 does not require heads in the closets when they meet what two provisions?
answer: Less than 24 sq ft and least dimension less than 3 feet (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.15.8.2)

question: How often is lateral sway bracing needed for feed and cross mains?
Maximum distance after check valve that the FDC must be located?
What is the spare sprinkler head schedule?
How many manual and automatic starts are needed when performing acceptance testing of fire pump?
Minimum size of discharge on tank?
answer: 6 inches in most cases but not less than 2" (NFPA 22 2013 Edition, Section 14.2)

question: What is the minimum distance required of a lintel to have it considered a compartment?
What distance changes the spacing of sprinkler heads when dealing with vertical ceiling height changes?
answer: >36 inches heads must be equally spaced from both sides of the soffit (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.6.5.1)

question: What types of sprinkler heads can be used on dry systems?
answer: Uprights, sidewalls (if no trap), listed dry pendants/sidewalls (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 7.2.2)

question: Dry systems air leakage allowed per week (Acceptance Test)?
answer: 1.5 psi in 24 hrs (Existing system maintenance: 3 psi per week) (NFPA 13 2016 Section 25.2.2 / NFPA 25)

question: What is the maximum volume of an antifreeze loop?
answer: 40 gallons in NFPA 13D and NFPA 13R (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 7.6.2)

question: Who invented pipe calculations?
How much weight should a hanger be able to support?
answer: Water filled pipe plus 250 lbs (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 9.1.1.2)

question: How many gauges are on a dry pipe system?
How many heads do you calculate on an NFPA 13R type system?
answer: Up to a maximum of four (NFPA 13R 2016 Edition, Section 11.2)

question: Light hazard small room rule is what?
answer: Unobstructed construction and an area of not more than 800 sq ft that is enclosed (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 3.3.23)

question: Post indicator valves shall be located not less than how many feet from a building?
What is the universal code that deals with fire protection?
answer: IFC (International Fire Code) / MSFC (MN State Fire Code)

question: Minimum square feet of ESFR heads?
What materials are left for the owner after job completion?
answer: Copy of NFPA 25, data sheets, instructions, spare heads/wrench (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 25.5)

question: How much clearance is needed around pipe in a pump house that passes through walls?
How many heads are allowed on branch lines on either side of a cross main (Light Hazard Schedule)?
How many heads are needed before an FDC is required?
What is a manual standpipe system?
answer: Relies on pressure boost from fire department pumper truck via FDC (NFPA 14 2016 Edition, Section 3.3.17)

question: CPVC pipe and fittings should be protected against freezing with what type of system?
Post indicator valves shall be set so that the top of the post is how far above the final grade?
Class I and III standpipes shall be of at least what size?
What is the standard procedure for a hydrostatic test?
answer: 200 psi or 50 psi over if >150 psi, 2 hours (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 25.2.1)

question: How many heads are needed on a system before supervision is required?
What is the largest pipe size that can have a threaded union installed on it?
Unsupported length on the end of branch lines from the last hanger location for 1¼" pipe?
What size of predrilled hole is needed for the lag screw?
answer: 1/16" less than diameter of bolt (wood) (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 9.1.5.3)

question: What is the largest pipe size that can be hung from a toggle hanger?
How often does an electric fire pump need to be operated at rated speed?
Maximum pressure of a 2½" hose valve on a standpipe system?
Maximum gallons for a dry system?
answer: 750 gallons (without quick opening device) (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 7.2.3)

question: Trapped water less than 5 gallons, between 5 and 50 gallons, and greater than 50 gallons require what size auxiliary drain?
Where does an FDC need to be located?
answer: Street side and within 100 feet of a hydrant (NFPA 14 2016 Edition, Section 6.4)

question: Ordinary hazard, if your heads are located 12’6" apart along the branch line, what is the maximum distance between the lines allowed?
answer: 10.4 feet (130 sq ft / 12.5 ft = 10.4 ft) (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 8.6.2.2.1(b))

question: When tightening heads, in what direction should the arms of the sprinkler heads be?
What is the maximum sprinkler spacing for an extra hazard system?
answer: Pipe schedule = 90 sq ft; Calculated ≥.25 = 100 sq ft; Calculated <.25 = 130 sq ft (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Table 8.6.2.2.1(c))

question: What is the maximum allowable distance between the ceiling and deflector below a non-combustible ceiling?
Sidewall sprinkler head deflectors should be what distance down from the finished ceiling?
What is the pressure requirement at the top of the standpipe?
How often should sprinkler heads be replaced in commercial type cooking equipment and ventilating systems?
What is the minimum spacing between an upright sprinkler head and a hanger rod?
On a plastic system, what is the minimum pipe size?
Maximum horizontal sprinkler head spacing for in-rack sprinklers?
answer: 10 ft (Note: Varies by commodity, check Table 16.2.1.3.2) (NFPA 13 2016 Edition)

question: Pressure relief valves should be used on what type of system?
On a dry pipe valve, what is the ratio water to air?
On a 2500 gpm pump or smaller, what size automatic relief valve is required?
answer: ¾" for pumps 2500 gpm and under and 1" for larger pumps (NFPA 20 2016 Edition, Table 4.11.2)

question: Controllers for fire pumps shall be mounted at least how far above the floor?
Fuel tanks for fire pumps shall have a capacity at least equal to what?
answer: 1 gallon per HP plus 5% volume for expansion plus 5% volume for sump (NFPA 20 2016 Edition, Section 11.4.3)

question: Sensing lines for fire pumps shall consist of what type and size of piping?
answer: Brass, copper, or stainless steel ½" (NFPA 20 2016 Edition, Section 4.31)

question: What size rod is required for hanging 10 inch and 12 inch pipe?
Horizontal piping from a standpipe to hose valve shall require a hanger at what length?
Standpipes that are part of a combined system shall be at least what pipe size?
answer: 4" for completely sprinkled buildings otherwise 6" (NFPA 14 2016 Edition, Section 7.6.2)

question: Size of drain required for a 2½" standpipe?
In trenches cut through rock, what is the required tamped backfill under and around the pipe and how much above the pipe?
What type of heads are required if water temperature exceeds 100°F?
answer: Intermediate or high temperature (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, Section 8.3.2.4)

question: Sprinklers in rack shall discharge not less than how many psi for all classes of commodities?
A minimum of how many inches shall be maintained between the sprinkler deflector and the top of a tier of storage?
Pendant and upright sprinklers for residential application shall be positioned so that the deflectors are within how many inches from the ceiling?
For a water storage tank, the distance between the floor and any part of the tank shall be at least how many feet?
In light hazard, how many heads are allowed off 1½" pipe?
A relief valve on a dry system located between the compressor and control valve shall be set at _______ psi in excess of maximum air pressure in the system?
System components shall not be rated less than _________ psi for aboveground components and _________ psi for underground components?
Maximum operating pressure for extra hazard, palletized, solid piled, in bin box, and on shelf storage?
Minimum operating pressure of an in-rack sprinkler head?
Hours required for MN Test
NFPA __ is the Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems.
NFPA __ is the Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One- and Two-Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes.
NFPA __ is the Standard for the Installation of Sprinkler Systems in Low-Rise Residential Occupancies.
NFPA __ is the Standard for the Installation of Standpipes and Hose Systems.
NFPA __ is the Standard for the Installation of Private Fire Hydrants.
NFPA __ is the Standard for the Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection Systems.
NFPA __ is the Standard for the Installation of Stationary Pumps for Fire Protection.
NFPA __ is the Standard for Water Tanks for Private Fire Protection.
Class ___ standpipe: 2½" connections FD use
Class ___ standpipe: 1½" connections occupant
Class ___ standpipe: Both 1½"/2½"
If fire pump suction pipe is perpendicular to fire pump and the pipe is 8 inch pipe, how far does the pump suction flange have to be from the elbow?
Per NFPA 13 2016 if you have to use a heat collector because the sprinkler is too far down from the deck it needs to be _____ inches below the deck.
answer: Not Allowed (NFPA 13 2016 Edition, 8.6.3.2.1 - Heat collectors generally not permitted for standard heads)

question: The discharge pipe of a fire pump is bigger than the discharge flange of the fire pump. Which fitting is needed to make the change?
In the types of system listed below, which one is not ok with a paddle type water flow switch installed?
Wet pipe systems shall only be installed in areas where the temperature is maintained at ______ degrees at its lowest point.
It is an acceptable practice to install a paddle-type water flow switch on the bottom of a horizontal main?
Upright sprinklers on pipes _____ inch or larger must be placed on sprigs or offset from the pipe to eliminate the obstruction.
When installing upright sprinklers in a branch line piping system, the frame arms of the sprinkler shall be lined up _______ with the branch line as to eliminate an obstruction.
True or False. Jockey pumps, jockey control valves, and jockey check valves are not required to be listed for fire protection use.

All wet systems that do not contain an air reservoir must have a listed relief valve installed in the system. The relief valve must be set to relieve pressure at 175 psi or _____ psi above maximum system pressure.
In a dry system where the capacity of trapped section of pipe is 5 gallons or less, the auxiliary drain shall consist of a valve ___ inch or larger, nipple and cap?
In a dry system where the capacity of trapped section of pipe is more than 5 gallons, the auxiliary drain shall consist of two 1 inch valves and one ___ inch nipple.
Although using tie in drains on a dry system is essentially making a gridded dry system, it is allowed as long as the pipe is ___ inch size and is pitched at a 1/2 inch per 10 feet?
When installing a dry system and performing the final acceptance test, the system needs to be air pressure tested at 40 psi for ___ hours?
Residential sprinklers have a different discharge pattern than standard spray sprinkler. They are required to wet the wall within ___ inches of the ceiling?
Per MN state fire marshal, Central oring sprinklers do not have to be changed as long as they are installed in systems with high pressures. True or False.
A sprinkler system employing open sprinklers would be classified as what type of system?
The larger the air bubble in an glass bulb sprinkler, the _______ it takes before the sprinkler activates?
What is the maximum width of an obstruction before you need to add a sprinkler under the obstruction on an ESFR system?
Where ESFR sprinkler are installed adjacent to sprinkler system with standard-response sprinklers, a draft curtain of noncombustible construction and at least ___ in depth is required.
What is the maximum square footage of any one standard spray sprinkler is ___?
If installing a sprinkler system in a building with less than 300 sprinklers how many sprinklers shall be installed in spare sprinkler cabinet?
When installing a sprinkler system with over 300 sprinklers but less than 1000 sprinklers how many sprinkler shall be installed in the spare sprinkler cabinet?
When installing a sprinkler system with over 1,000 sprinkler how many sprinklers shall be installed in the spare sprinkler cabinet?
When installing a sprinkler system, a list of spare sprinklers left on site needs to be left on site in the spare head cabinet. Which item does not have to be on this list?
FDC piping of 4" or larger requires that the FDC connection have two inlets on it. If the piping of the FDC is ____ or smaller one outlet is satisfactory?
Per NFPA 13 what is the maximum time water can flow without tripping the flow switch?
If you have to install 3 dry systems in a building, and all 3 systems share an air compressor, how many air maintenance devices need to be installed?
What is the maximum number of sprinklers that can be installed on any one pre action system?
What is the maximum size building that one system can cover in light or ordinary hazard buildings?
What type of sprinklers are required in skylights?
A sprinkler with blue liquid in the bulb would discharge at what temperature?
A glass bulb sprinkler with red liquid in the bulb would be what temperature?
When measuring the distance from a metal pan deck to the sprinkler, measure from the low part of the pan unless the pan is ____ or larger then you would measure to the upper part of the pan.
With Standard spray sprinklers obstructions to discharge over ____ wide require sprinklers to be installed under the obstruction

If an obstruction is over 4 ft wide requiring sprinklers be installed under the obstruction, it is acceptable to add sprinklers next to the obstruction as long as the sprinkler is within ____ from the outside edge of the obstruction?
Skylight under ____ sq ft are not required to have sprinklers installed?
Skylights under _______ ft from another unprotected skylight require sprinklers?
What is the maximum area that a sprinkler can protect?
What is the maximum square footage that a standard spray sprinkler can be spaced in a light hazard occupancy?
What is the maximum square footage of a standard spray sprinkler in an ordinary hazard occupancy?
